author: m.kalinin
content: `exit_balance_to_consume`, `earliest_exit_epoch` aren't related to withdrawal requests, those are artefacts of switching the churn from validator count to the amount of stake.

author: m.kalinin
content: i think we should raise this on one of the calls and be vocal about it, so 4788 devs can reach out to us and raise their concerns

author: etan_status
content: so I guess one would need 4 groups, which wouldn't prevent going over 32 fields. or, a single `request_processing` / `validator_churn` / `churn_management` group that contains all of them. one issue is that 4788 devs are not well represented in the calls. but highlighting it to at least have a chance for collecting feedback makes sense to me.

author: etan_status
content: for context, RocketPool (https://x.com/KaneWallmann/status/1816729724145795258), EigenLayer (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7688-forward-compatible-consensus-data-structures/19673/7), as well as research (https://ethresear.ch/t/slashing-proofoor-on-chain-slashed-validator-proofs/19421/3), and even our own light client protocol (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/light-client/sync-protocol.md) are affected by the reindexing, but for electra it's more of an annoyance rather than a large issue. while it would be nice if one could avoid the reindexing, if there is no logical grouping possible that prevents the problem, I think that reindexing is acceptable, especially as historically, forward compatibility was never guaranteed for EIP-4788.
